title: Proclamation: National School Choice Week, 2026
summary: Presidential proclamation designates National School Choice Week for 2026 and calls on states, communities, and families to observe the week. The document emphasizes the value of parental and family choice in educational options and outlines the goal of increasing awareness and participation in activities that support school choice, reflecting on the tradition of individual liberty in education.

title: Executive Order on Promoting Fair Competition in the Residential Housing Market
summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to examine and address practices in the residential housing market that may disproportionately advantage large financial institutions over individual homebuyers. It emphasizes protecting consumers, increasing transparency in mortgage and home-purchase processes, and coordinating cross-agency actions to develop policies aimed at enhancing competition and affordability in homeownership.

title: Proclamation: National Day of Patriotic Devotion, 2026
summary: Presidential proclamation designating National Day of Patriotic Devotion for 2026. The proclamation calls for nationwide observance and reflection on commitments to national sovereignty, public safety, the balance of justice, and the pursuit of a prosperous nation, building on the President's stated objectives from the previous year.

title: Proclamation on Religious Freedom Day, 2026
summary: The President proclaims Religious Freedom Day, 2026, reaffirming the United States' longstanding commitment to freedom of religion, freedom of conscience, and freedom to worship without fear. The proclamation notes that the nation marks 250 years since its founding and emphasizes that every person possesses the right to practice their faith, follow their conscience, and worship according to their beliefs. It describes the observance of Religious Freedom Day as an opportunity to reflect on the value of religious liberty and to promote its protection and inclusion for all Americans.

title: Adjusting Imports of Semiconductors, Semiconductor Manufacturing Equipment, and Their Derivative Products into the United States
summary: This presidential proclamation describes that the Secretary of Commerce transmitted to the President a report on December 22, 2025 regarding a Section 232 national-security investigation into the effects of imports of semiconductors, semiconductor manufacturing equipment, and their derivative products. Based on the findings in that report, the President exercises authority under Section 232 to adjust imports of these items into the United States. The document identifies the scope of the investigation and the use of executive action to modify import levels to address national-security considerations related to the supply chain for semiconductors and related equipment.

title: Establishment of a Second Emergency Board to Investigate Disputes Between the Long Island Rail Road Company and Employees Represented by Specified Labor Organizations
summary: Under the Railway Labor Act, the President establishes a second emergency board to investigate disputes between the Long Island Rail Road Company and certain of its employees represented by the Transportation Communications Union, the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen, the Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers, and the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. The board is charged with examining the issues in dispute, gathering information from the employer and the employee representatives, and issuing findings and recommendations aimed at facilitating a voluntary settlement between the parties. The board will operate for a defined period and must submit its report, including conclusions and recommendations, to the parties and the President.

title: Proclamation Adjusting Imports of Processed Critical Minerals and Their Derivative Products into the United States
summary: A proclamation issued by the President states that, following a report transmitted by the Secretary of Commerce on October 24, 2025, regarding the effects of imports of processed critical minerals and their derivative products (PCMDPs) on United States national security under section 232, the President is implementing adjustments to the import of these goods into the United States. The proclamation references the investigation conducted under section 232 and the Secretary's report and directs actions consistent with adjusting imports of PCMDPs.
